title: OT28: Where In The World Is Comment Sandiego?
summary:
Key ideas:
- Author addresses a misapprehension from one of his past posts regarding psychiatrists involuntarily committing people with suicidal thoughts.
- Comment of the week is Gwern’s reanalysis of the cost-benefit ratio of some low-specificity suicide biomarkers.
- Some corrections from the last links post are mentioned.
- Author agrees that preventing pandemics is an important underserved area and asks if there are any good organizations working on the issue that accept donations.

Key learnings:
- Most outpatient psychiatrists are comfortable with people who have occasional suicidal thoughts as long as they say they don’t immediately plan to act on them.
- Preventing pandemics is an important area that needs more attention.

Key questions:
- Are there any good organizations working on preventing pandemics that accept donations?
